questions.q: Who led the Revolt of 1857 in Kanpur?
questions.e: Nana Saheb was a prominent leader of the 1857 Revolt in Kanpur against British rule.

questions.q: The Non-Cooperation Movement was launched in which year?
questions.e: The Non-Cooperation Movement, led by Mahatma Gandhi, was launched in 1920 to oppose British policies.

questions.q: Who wrote the book 'Discovery of India'?
questions.e: 'Discovery of India' was authored by Jawaharlal Nehru during his imprisonment in 1942â€“1946.

questions.q: The Partition of Bengal occurred in which year?
questions.e: The British partitioned Bengal in 1905 to weaken the growing nationalist movement.

questions.q: Who was the first Governor-General of independent India?
questions.e: Lord Mountbatten served as the first Governor-General of independent India in 1947.

questions.q: Which act introduced the principle of 'Separate Electorate' in India?
questions.e: The Indian Councils Act of 1909 introduced separate electorates for Muslims.
Mahatma Gandhi coined 'Satyagraha' to describe his philosophy of nonviolent resistance.

questions.q: Which of the following is considered the Magna Carta of Indian Education?
questions.e: Wood's Despatch of 1854 laid the foundation for modern education in India, earning it the title 'Magna Carta of Indian Education.'

questions.q: The Champaran Satyagraha was related to which issue?
questions.e: The Champaran Satyagraha protested the exploitation of farmers growing indigo under oppressive conditions.

questions.q: Who started the 'Servants of India Society'?
questions.e: Gopal Krishna Gokhale founded the 'Servants of India Society' in 1905 to promote education and social reform.
